# Government Tender Announcement

## Standing Offer for Security Guard Services

### Project ID: WA229001

* Publication Date: August 17, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: September 7, 2023 (14:00:00)
* Amendment Date: September 7, 2023

### Procurement Details

* Contracting Entity: Defence Construction Canada (DCC)
* Procurement Category: SRV (Services)
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Trade Agreements: None
* Regions of Opportunity: Ottawa
* Regions of Delivery: Ottawa, Gatineau

### Tender Description

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites qualified contractors to submit a standing offer for security guard services in the National Capital Region. The contract will provide security guard services at various locations throughout the region.

### Contract Requirements

* The contractor must hold a valid Facility Security Clearance at the level of SECRET issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP) within Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC).
* The contractor must supply labour, materials, supervision, and equipment necessary for the provision of licensed security guard services.
* The maximum amount that can be expended under this standing offer is $500,000.

### Tender Document Requirements

* The plans and specifications (P&S) for this opportunity may be ordered from MERX.
* Bidders must register on MERX to access the tender documents.
* Amendments to the tender documents should only be obtained from MERX to ensure the latest version is received.

### Submissions and Evaluation

* Submissions will be evaluated based on the lowest price.
* Bidders who contact anyone other than the DCC Contracting Authority to obtain clarifications during the solicitation period may, for that reason alone, be disqualified.

### Award and Payment

* Contract award results will be publicly disclosed on the DCC website.
* DCC publicly discloses information on payments made to prime contractors.

To submit your standing offer, please access the MERX website for the tender documents and registration information. All enquiries and questions should be directed to the DCC Contracting Authority.

Note: The contractor's name has been removed for security purposes. For further details regarding the security requirements, please consult the tender documents.
